Package gui

Class StatePlaying

java.lang.Object
gui.StatePlaying
All Implemented Interfaces:
State
public class StatePlaying extends Object implements State
Class handles the user interaction while the game is in the third stage where the user plays the game. This class is part of a state pattern for the Controller class. It implements a state-dependent behavior that controls the display and reacts to key board input from a user. At this point user keyboard input is first dealt with a key listener in control and then and then handed over by way of the handleUserInput method. Responsibilities: Keep track of the current position and direction in the game. Show the first person view and the map view, Accept input for manual operation (left, right, up, down etc), Update the graphics, recognize termination. This code contains refactored code from Maze.java by Paul Falstad, www.falstad.com, Copyright (C) 1998, all rights reserved Paul Falstad granted permission to modify and use code for teaching purposes. Refactored by Peter Kemper

    • getRobot

      public Robot getRobot()
      The robot that is used in the automated playing mode. Null if run in the manual mode.
      Returns:
      the robot, may be null

    • start

      public void start​(Control controller, MazePanel panel)
      Start the actual game play by showing the playing screen. If the panel is null, all drawing operations are skipped. This mode of operation is useful for testing purposes, i.e., a dryrun of the game without the graphics part.
      Specified by:
      start in interface State
      Parameters:
      controller - provides access to the controller this state resides in
      panel - is part of the UI and visible on the screen, needed for drawing

    • switchFromPlayingToWinning

      Switches the controller to the final screen
      Parameters:
      pathLength - gives the length of the path

    • handleUserInput

      public boolean handleUserInput​(Constants.UserInput userInput, int value)
      The method provides an appropriate response to user keyboard input. The control calls this method to communicate input and delegate its handling. Method requires start to be called before.
      Specified by:
      handleUserInput in interface State
      Parameters:
      userInput - provides the feature the user selected
      value - is not used in this state, exists only for consistency across State classes
      Returns:
      false if not started yet otherwise true
